quizInfo.Subject: Systems Integration and Architecture
quizInfo.Title: Full Course Review
References: Any external links/handouts should be referenced here

quizData.question: What does SAP stand for?
What is the full name of SAP?
quizData.answer: System Applications and Products in Data Processing
choices: System Applications and Products in Data Processing
System Architecture and Products in Business Processing
System Applications and Products in Data Encoding
System Architecture and Products in Database Processing

quizData.question: SAP is the market leader in enterprise application software.
SAP is a Swedish multinational company that pioneered the use of ERP in businesses.
SAP lets companies streamline processes, use live data, predict customer trends, and connect entire businesses.
What year was SAP founded for development of real-time data application software?
What year was SAP R/2 introduced?
What year was SAP R/3 developed and presented at the CeBIT Hanover?
What year did Microsoft and IBM started using SAP R/3 into their systems?
What year did SAP joined the internet with SAP R/3 becoming usable online?
What year did SAP celebrated their 30th anniversary and became the third largest software provider?
What year did SAP announced the release of SAP ERP?
What year did SAP Business Suite 7 release, aiming to optimize performance and reduce IT costs?
What year did SAP HANA release, a result from the implementation of the first SAP in-memory computing product?
What year did SAP Business Suite moved to SAP HANA, making it the fastest-growing product in the history of enterprise software?
What year was SAP S/4 HANA introduced?
SAP ERP is the standard ERP solution for companies around the world.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. SAP ERP enables a company to support and optimize its business processes.
II. SAP's strategic goal is to develop the next-generation ERP package.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question:
Which of the following statements are true?
I. SAP R/3 is the next-generation business suite.
II. It is a result of SAP's strategic goal to develop the next-generation ERP package.
quizData.answer: I is false, II is true.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question:
Which of the following statements are true?
I. SAP S/4 HANA uses real-time simplification that compresses multiple tables into a less cluttered one.
II. SAP S/4 HANA uses the traditional database architecture.
quizData.answer: I is true, II is false.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question:
Which of the following statements are true?
I. SAP S/4 HANA uses its own data model called the S/4 HANA Data Model.
II. This allwos data storage in denormalized form, have a single data source, remove data storage, and process aggregation and analytics on the fly.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question:
What term in this statement makes it FALSE ?
The traditional database structure uses redundant data to increase data retrieval performance.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. SAP ERP is designed to strengthen companies in various industries.
II. SAP S/4 HANA caters more to a large, enterprise-level organizations.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question: This is a design system and a UX layer that allows business app creation with a consumer-grade user experience.
SAP Fiori makes casual users into SAP experts with simple screens that is viewable in every device.
The following are the three application types in SAP Fiori EXCEPT ONE.
This application type of SAP Fiori is used to access tasks like Create, Change, or Display process with guided navigation.
This application type of SAP Fiori gives a visual overview of the business data.
This application type of SAP Fiori gives a view of the essential information about objects and contextual navigation between related objects.
The following are the three data types included in ERP systems EXCEPT ONE.
The examples of this ERP data type is company codes, plant, storage location, and distribution channel.
The examples of this ERP data type is persons, materials, customers, and vendors.
This ERP data type can be stored for a long time and rarely changed.
This ERP data type represents logically grouped data such as customer, material, vendor masters and general ledger accouunts.
This ERP data type is the system record of the business event wherein, depending on the business event, different master data and organization data will be referenced.
It is the data sets generated if a business transaction is executed.
choices: Transaction of the Transactional Transactions made during a Transaction

quizData.question: It is the record of the business transaction.
An example of a document are sales, purchasing, material, and account documents.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. The document flow and the order status allows the setting of the status at any point in time.
II. SAP revises the status every time a change in a document takes place.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question:
What makes the statement wrong?
SAP S/4 HANA can be accessed on the Cloud and Physically.
choices: SAP S/4 HANA; it should be My heart

quizData.question: This edition of SAP S/4 HANA has a subscription licensing deployed in the systems provided and maintained by SAP.
This edition of SAP S/4 HANA allows automatic participation in quarterly innovation upgrades and has current release cycles.
This edition of SAP S/4 HANA is under traditional licensing where the customer is in charge of its deployment and maintenance.
This edition of SAP S/4 HANA has its data privately controlled and has fewer release cycles.
The following are the three optimization levers considered in SAP S/4 HANA EXCEPT ONE.
This optimization lever of SAP S/4 HANA focuses on accelerated execution, automated process steps, and digital out-tasking.
This optimization lever of SAP S/4 HANA focuses on speeding up actions, delayering of processes, and raising process intelligence.
This optimization lever of SAP S/4 HANA focuses on process flexibility, organizational flexibility, and assimilating process innovation.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Real-time inventory management

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
No separation of data entities from different tables.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Real-time product availability.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Parallel postings and processes.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Increased inventory turnover.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Frequent updates.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Faster operational reporting

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
1 document table instead of 26 aggregate tables.

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Fewer stockouts

Identify if the application of optimization levers apply to business or IT:
Reduced memory footprint
Refers to the new implementation of SAP S/4 HANA for customers migrating a legacy system.
This scenario refers to the conversion of a legacy system into the SAP S/4 HANA system.

What makes the statement wrong?
Reengineering the process aggregation based on ready-to-run business processes.

What makes the statement wrong?
Predefined migration objects and best practices are available without guided configuration.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. The greenfield approach reduces time to value and customer total cost of ownership (TCO)
The greenfield approach rapidly adopts innovations.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question: This type of transition require project duration parameters such as the number of data migration objects and volume and complexity per data migration object.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. The greenfield approach process beings with the installation of SAP S/4 HANA and an initial data load from the source system.
II. Tools used are SAP Data Services (SAP DS) for On-Premise and SAP Landscape Transformation (SAP LT) for Cloud.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question: This scenario refers to the conversion of their current system into the SAP S/4 HANA system that shows the database, SAP NetWeaver, and application transition in a single step.
System conversion doesn't require reimplementation in migration.
System conversion will disrupt the existing business process.
System conversion involves the reevaluation of customization and existing process flows, where certain processes can be adapted to SAP S/4 HANA.
This type of transition requires the number of systems and source data base size and the number of company codes, ledgers, and operating concerns as its project duration parameters.
System conversion must involve making sure that add-ons and other solutions are compatible, and that components and customer code to validate further prerequisites must be checked.
This scenario refers to the consolidation of the user's data or selectively transform it into an SAP S/4 HANA system.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. Selective data transformation allows a phased approach, focusing on parts of the business with the highest return of investment and lower TCO.
II. System and landscape consolidation with harmonized/simplified processes and unified master data leads to lower TCO.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question: This type of transition depends on the selected sub-scenario, such as system consolidation, selective migration, and central finance as its general project duration parameters.
In landscape transformation, the specified parameters include the number of systems to be consolidated, including the volume of the selected data for its general project duration.

Which of the following statements are true?
I. Consolidation involves clients being consolidated from different source systems into 1 new or existing SAP S/4 HANA system using the SAP LT (Landscape Transformation) Tool.
II. Selective Data Transformation involves all SAP applications, such as central finance, being migrated using the SAP LT Tool.
quizData.answer: I is false, II is true.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question: Global Bike Inc. uses a practical design philosophy that roots from its experience in off-road and long-distance racing sports.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. had experience with downhill and cross-country championships in mountain racing circuits in America.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. first sold bikes that were rebuilt from old bikes into a sort of Frankenstein bike.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. came from Heidelberg, Germany.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. studied engineering and competed on occassional regional races.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. worked at a bike shop fixing student bikes and tuning touring bikes he and his friends rode for competitions.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. first starte Heidelberg Composites.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. first started Frankenstein Bikes.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. expanded his bike businesses into a manufacturing facility in Dallas, US.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. designed and built road bikes based on an ultra-light composite frame for one of his engineering courses.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. started his first business that eventually became the leader in lightweight touring frames in Europe.
What year did John Davis and Peter Schwarz met and recognized their mutual passion for performance and complimentary business models?
Frankenstein Bikes and Heidelberg Composites merged in 2001, forming Global Bike Inc.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. manages the sales, marketing, service and support, IT, finance, and human resources groups of the company.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. manages the research, design, procurement, and manufacturing groups of the company.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. is responsible for Idea-to-Market and Build-to-Stock areas of the company.
This founder of Global Bike Inc. is responsible for Order-to-Cash and Service & Support along with supporting services for the 2 aforementioned processes and Idea-to-Market and Build-to-Stock.
Global Bike Inc. invested into this kind of strategy, where they have focused on innovation, quality, safety, and speed to market.

What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. having an extensive innovation network to source ideas from various users and professionals to improve their bicycle's quality, performance, and reliability?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. offering two models of signature road bikes, with two different types of wheels for each of the models respectively?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. manufacturing two types of off-road for both the male and female model?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. offering other accessories other than the bikes themselves?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. having 2 production facilities in Dallas and Heidelberg that has 3 assembly lines producing thousands of bikes annually?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. having a total production capacity of about 6,000 bikes yearly that can also be increased by 15% - 20% through overtime and part-time workers?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. outsourcing the production of off-road and touring frames along with carbon composite wheels to trusted partners?

What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. maintaining collaborative research and design relationships with partner facilities that ensures innovations in both material and structural capabilities are included in the company's frames?

What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. assembling semi-finished and finished goods at its production facilities that are then either stored in the warehouse or shipped to regional distribution centers?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. exclusively selling their products through reputable and respected Independent Bicycle Dealers (IBDs)?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. using the internet as its information channel to educate consumers and market its products?

What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. having its main sales channel through specialty resellers due to tax issues and selling constraints for operating a business in multiple states and countries.
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. establishing an extensive partner operation ensuring process continuity between its partners to provide best-in-class product?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. nurturing and protecting strong relationships with suppliers, which they are usually the largest customer of?
What business strategy involves Global Bike Inc. using a shared services model on their offices?
What year was it when Global Bike Inc. moved to centralized IT which also led to their implementation of SAP ERP 6?

Which of the following statements are true?
I. The centralization of Global Bike Inc.'s ERP functions led to a reduction of costs and deliverance of global best-in-class technology in its divisions.
II. Their approach gave the company an advanced business platform under a highly controlled environment, enabling consistency of operations and process integrity across the globe.
choices: I is true, II is false.
I is false, II is true.

quizData.question: What year was it when Global Bike Inc. moved its management to SAP S/4 HANA to accelerate its digital transformation?
Which module allows organizations to store and manage customer and product-related data?
What is the smallest organizational unit where a legal set of books can be maintained?
Which SD organizational unit is responsible for the sale of specific products or services?
What is the purpose of a credit control area?
How are products or services grouped in an SD organizational structure?
Which data category in the customer master contains information relevant to the entire organization?
What are the three areas into which the customer master is divided?
choices: General data, Company code data, Sales area data
General data, Material data, Sales data
Company code data, Sales data, Storage data
General data, Profit center data, Sales area data
quizData.answer: General data, Company code data, Sales area data

quizData.question: What master data contains all the information a company needs to manage about a material?
Which type of master data includes prices, surcharges, discounts, freights, and taxes?
What is the first step in the order-to-cash / sales order process?
What is the purpose of pre-sales activities in the SD module?
choices: Assist the process of sales, distribution, and marketing
quizData.answer: Assist the process of sales, distribution, and marketing

quizData.question: From which documents or activities can the sales order entry process originate?
choices: Phone or email orders, existing contracts, and quotations
quizData.answer: Phone or email orders, existing contracts, and quotations

quizData.question: What are the three primary areas of a sales document?
choices: Sales area, Line item(s), Availability check
Billing information, Shipping information, Delivery schedule

quizData.question: What does the delivery schedule specify when an order is created?
Which function determines the shipping point and route for delivering goods to customers?
What is the purpose of the credit limit check during sales order entry?
What does the availability check in the sales order entry process determine?
choices: Material availability based on inventory movements
quizData.answer: Material availability based on inventory movements

quizData.question: Which document controls and monitors sub-processes like picking, packing, and posting goods issue?
What does the goods issue in the shipping process signify?
choices: Legal change in ownership of products
quizData.answer: Legal change in ownership of products

quizData.question: Which billing method involves creating invoices based on delivered goods?
What does the payment process in sales order management involve?
choices: Posting payments against invoices and reconciling differences
quizData.answer: Posting payments against invoices and reconciling differences

quizData.question: What can be used in SAP to find the status of an order at any point in time?
choices: Document flow and order status feature
quizData.answer: Document flow and order status feature

quizData.question: Which unit is responsible for negotiating the conditions of purchase with vendors?
What is the purpose of the vendor master in SAP?
choices: Contains all necessary info for business activities with an external supplier
Manages material quantities in storage locations
quizData.answer: Contains all necessary info for business activities with an external supplier

quizData.question: Where is the material master data maintained?
What does the purchasing information record provide?
Which view of the vendor master includes terms of payment and bank account details?
What function does the purchasing group serve?
choices: Represents the buyer responsible for certain purchasing activities
quizData.answer: Represents the buyer responsible for certain purchasing activities

quizData.question: Where is the storing of specific details on delivery plants and loading groups managed?
What document initiates a specific request for goods or services within a company?
Which method can be used to create a purchase requisition automatically?
Which record specifies the allowed means for procuring material for a certain plant within a given period?
What types of longer-term purchasing agreements are included in outline agreements?
What is the purpose of an RFQ (Request for Quotation)?
choices: To request materials from vendors automatically
To initiate the goods receipt process

quizData.question: What does the vendor's response to an RFQ become in SAP?
What is evaluated through vendor evaluation in MM?
Which document formally requests a vendor to supply specific materials or services?
What is represented by a movement type in the Goods Receipt process?
What is the final step in the Procure-to-Pay process in MM?

What is the process of aligning demand with manufacturing capacity in creating production and procurement 
schedules for the finished products and component materials?
This is what you call the independent environment in the system.
(?????) is the smallest organizational unit where a legal set of books can be maintained.
(?????) is the operating area or branch within the company, such as manufacturing, distribution, purchasing, or maintenance facility.
(?????) allows differentiation between the various stocks of material in a plant.
(?????) define where and when the operation is performed. These can be machines, people, production lines, or groups of tradespeople.
This master data contains all the information a company needs to manage a material.
This master data lists the component that make up a product or assembly.
It is the series of sequential steps or operations that must be carried out to produce a given product.
It is the location within a plant where Value-added work is performed.
It is aggregate planning that group materials or other product groups.
What are the three different kinds of Bill of Materials?

(?????) is the foundation of a reliable Sales and Operations Planning (SOP). Accurate (?????) are essential in the 
manufacturing sector, which could help oversee the stock since overstocked and understocked warehouses 
both result in a profit loss
Which of the following aren't part of the Forecasting Model?
(?????) serves as the link between the Strategic Planning and Detailed Planning layers in Production Planning and Execution

(?????) allows a company to distinguish planning methods between materials that strongly influence profit or use 
critical resources and those that do not.

In (?????), the system calculates the net requirements while considering available warehouse stock and scheduled receipts from purchasing and production. During (?????), all levels of the bill of material are planned.
What is the primary purpose of the Controlling (CO) module in SAP?
choices: To provide an organization with a method of slicing and dicing data to view costs from an internal management perspective.
quizData.answer: To provide an organization with a method of slicing and dicing data to view costs from an internal management perspective.

quizData.question: What is another name for the Controlling (CO) module?
Which of the following is a goal of the CO Organizational Structure?
choices: Represent the legal and/or organizational views of an enterprise.
quizData.answer: Represent the legal and/or organizational views of an enterprise.

quizData.question: What is the smallest organizational unit where a legal set of books can be maintained in SAP?
Which organizational unit in SAP Controlling is described as 'Self-contained unit for which revenues and expenses can be managed'?
What is a Profit Center responsible for?
choices: Neither revenue generation nor cost containment.

quizData.question: What is the purpose of an Internal Order in SAP CO?
choices: To contain costs for a temporary activity or project.
To allocate costs between cost centers.
quizData.answer: To contain costs for a temporary activity or project.

quizData.question: What is the relationship between a General Ledger revenue account and a CO revenue element?
Which cost element arises through the consumption of production factors that are sourced externally?
Which method is used for periodically allocating primary cost elements?
What is the primary use of Statistical Key Figures in SAP CO?
choices: Support internal cost allocations involving allocations, assessments, and distributions.
quizData.answer: Support internal cost allocations involving allocations, assessments, and distributions.

quizData.question: In S/4HANA, what replaces the separate cost element master data maintenance?
Which transaction can be used to view default account assignments transferred from the cost element master in S/4HANA?
In S/4HANA, how many levels are G/L accounts attributed to?
What does the Universal Journal in S/4HANA combine account assignments from?
choices: Controlling, Profitability Analysis, and Enterprise Controlling
quizData.answer: Controlling, Profitability Analysis, and Enterprise Controlling

quizData.question: Which of the following is NOT an innovation provided by the Universal Journal?
What is now obligatory and automatically active in all SAP S/4HANA systems?
In S/4HANA, the Material Ledger allows the system to manage material prices in how many currencies/valuations?
Which transaction replaces CKM3/CKM3N in S/4HANA?
Which of the following is NOT a goal of the CO Organizational Structure?
choices: Represent the legal and/or organizational views of an enterprise
Support the development and presentation of relevant information
Permit accurate and organized collection of business information

quizData.question: What is the primary function of a Company Code in the CO Organizational Structure?
choices: Represent the legal and/or organizational views of an enterprise
Maintain a legal set of books
quizData.answer: Maintain a legal set of books

quizData.question: Which organizational unit is defined as an independent environment in the system?
What does a Controlling Area in the CO Organizational Structure manage?
Which CO Master Data element is responsible for revenue generation and cost containment?
Which CO Master Data element is used to plan, collect, and monitor the costs associated with a distinct short-term event?
What type of cost element arises through the consumption of production factors that are sourced externally?
Which of the following is true about a Secondary Cost Element?
choices: It originates in the General Ledger within FI
It is used exclusively in CO for allocations and settlements
It corresponds to General Ledger accounts in FI
It is responsible for revenue generation and cost containment
quizData.answer: It is used exclusively in CO for allocations and settlements

quizData.question: What provides the foundation for accurate and effective cost allocation between cost objectives?
What must be assigned when creating a cost element to determine the transactions for which it can be used?
